member.name: T:Ice.Contracts.UserFileSvcContract
member.summary: User File Definition

member.name: M:Ice.Contracts.UserFileSvcContract.AddUserCompany(System.String,Ice.Tablesets.UserFileTableset@)
member.summary: This method will create a new row in the UserComp data table related to the given UserID.
member.param: The user ID for which a company will be added.
member.remarks: Use this method instead of GetNewUserComp(), which is generated by the BL framework--so it can't be deleted--but is unusable due to its lack of input parameters. Without an input parameter for the UserID, a new row has a blank user ID and blank company, which violates the dataset constraints.

member.summary: Changes the specified user's password.

member.summary: Save user settings. Unlike the Update method, there is no optimistic locking performed. So the settings are saved in a last in wins basis.
member.param: If set to true settings are saved.
If set to true then favorite bar is visible.
If set to true then the full tree is visible.
If set to true then the status bar is visible.
If set to true then the status panel company is visible.
If set to true then the status panel language is visible.
If set to true then the status panel plant is visible.
If set to true then the status panel server is visible.
If set to true then the status panel user identifier is visible.
If set to true then the status panel workstation identifier is visible.
If set to true then the status panel workstation identifier is visible.
Theme to be used for this user
The default form type the user prefers - WinForm or WebBridge.

member.name: P:Ice.Tablesets.UserFileRow.WebUser
member.summary: Indicates that the user has Web interface privileges. When this is turned on, the write trigger maintains certain fields in the WebUser table. If this is never turned on, a corresponding WebUser doesn't exist. If this has been on, and is now turned off, the WebUser record is set to disabled, but not deleted.

member.name: P:Ice.Tablesets.UserFileRow.CanDesignQSearch
member.summary: Allow user to design quick searches

member.name: P:Ice.Tablesets.UserFileRow.RequireSso
member.summary: Whether single sign-on (SSO) is required to log on. Select this check box to indicate that this user has to use his/her operating system (Windows, Unix, and so on) logon information as the logon for Vantage. Single Sign-On (SSO) is functionality that allows users to sign on (log in) to Vantage using the Login IDs and Passwords they use to log into their computer's operating system (for example Windows, Unix, Linux and so on). In other words, if SSO is enabled, users will not be presented with a Logon window when they click their Vantage icon; they will be taken directly to the application's main menu.

member.summary: Date that the password was last changed.

member.summary: Password expires x days after the password has been changed. Zero means the password does not automatically expire.

member.summary: The date that the user account password expires.

member.name: P:Ice.Tablesets.UserFileListRow.UseInternalWebBrowser
member.summary: Indicates that the internal web browser should be used instead of using the OS registered browser.

member.name: P:Ice.Tablesets.UserFileListRow.AllowMultipleSessions
member.summary: Allow user to start multiple sessions at the same time.

member.name: P:Ice.Tablesets.UserFileListRow.WebUser
member.summary: Indicates that the user has Web interface privileges. When this is turned on, the write trigger maintains certain fields in the WebUser table. If this is never turned on, a corresponding WebUser doesn't exist. If this has been on, and is now turned off, the WebUser record is set to disabled, but not deleted.

member.name: P:Ice.Tablesets.UserFileListRow.ListViewMode
member.summary: This property determines the viewing mode of the ListView object. The ListView object supports viewing items in four different modes: Icon(0),SmallIcon(1), List(2) and Report(3). Only 0 1 and 3 are used

member.summary: Global Company Security Manager Allows a user on a Isolated-Company system to behave like a user on a regular system. Can be allowed to login to multiple companies and can apply changes that affect all companies. Used to maintain menus and global customizations or security.
